intro: Sutera foliolosa, commonly known as the leafy sutera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a sunny to partially shaded location. Sutera foliolosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
